creator: Thomas.Krebs@mecadtron.de
text:
Hi,

my fo input can not be processed with fop 1.0. It used to work with 0.95.
The crash dump is:

fop.bat -q -fo user_manual.fo -pdf user_manual.pdf

I attach the fo input file.

Thomas

Created attachment 26449
The fo source of our german user manual

the file is 7z-ipped.
creator: Thomas.Krebs@mecadtron.de

text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 49837 ***
creator: spepping@apache.org

text:
This problem was recently solved in revision 1042115.

The problem is revealed by the fact that your manual uses words that consist of a single soft hyphen. In my view that is an error in your manual; one should use an em dash or an en dash in these places. As a bonus, that would work around the problem you report here.

If you cannot change that, you can use a recent version of fop from subversion, see http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/download.html, or apply the patch in revision 1042115 yourself.
creator: spepping@apache.org

text:
Simon,

I agree that we use hyphens in a wrong way. It is apparently sloppyness in using the minus ("-") key instead of distinguishing between the hyphen variants.

I removed such stand alone hyphens but the problems remains. As far as I can see there are stand alone hyphes generated by the docbook xsl that we use.

Nevertheless I think "reliable programs never crash" should apply here anyway...
I'll try the latest revision.

But thanks a lot for your help and a Happy New Year!

Thomas
creator: Thomas.Krebs@mecadtron.de
gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed for remaining resolved bugs
